Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pblades1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of madrid ive stayed 10 times in the last five years.the rooms are spotless cleaned everyday which for a 2 star is brill.dont have a go at staff because your ignorant or cant be bothered to learn spanish not everyone should pander to us , youre in spain learn some it goes a long long way if you do .hats off to nuria ive loved it everytime.phil masons sheffield

Reviews.Title: “good rooms and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Kalski123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon through Portugal and Spain, picking this place over the Intercontinental largely because of the price.Spacious guest rooms, exquisite furnishings,, wood paneled corridors. The hotel has a unique atmosphere and is very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as supposed”
Reviews.Author: EmilPetersson
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting a hotel, I get why you're disappointed. It's a hostel, and not a bad one of it's kind. There are 2 buildings, the right one definitely more modern, and hotel like, the left one is old and a hostel, this is the one where the restaurant is located. We were three guys who shared the smallest room in the entire hostel, and it wasn't bad at all! - Granted, the shower was small, but supplied hot water! The toilet was in the hall, and it's really not that bad when there is a lock on it. We had a bidet in the room though. All rooms come equipped with a TV, which was quite a surprise to me. The location is incredibly central. It is in the middle of the gay district of Madrid, which is very visible when you walk around. Close to several metro stations and bus stops. Don't eat the food in the hotel restaurant, it's really not that nutritious, and very dull. It's not poisonous though. There is a Starbucks and a Dunkin' Donuts 30 meters away, eat there instead if you please...at least breakfast. There is a lot of street noise, but not any that kept me from sleeping like a rock! The reception does not speak English, but if you're just a little bit friendly and interested, and learn to say your room number in Spanish, they are incredibly friendly and helpful! The cleaning is really good! They actually make your beds every day, despite it being a hostel and not a hotel. They give you fresh towels, and the cleaning personel event went as far as to fold my clothes that was on the bed, one day! The hostel is really not as bad as it is being portrayed in these reviews. It's a hostel, so don't expect much, but don't discard it completely, it's cheap and really good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Letty R
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was a little skeptical about the place. I went with my school and found it very nice. The people were nice and the service was good. Breakfast wasn't great so my friends and I ate at Starbucks at only (literally) 10 meters away. It is easily accessible by bus, only 10 minutes away from the bus stop. The rooms were clean, and the bathroom was too. We got EXCELLENT value for money. Sleep quality was fine, we didn't have trouble getting to sleep even if we were on the side of city. The location was amazing. Shops and food at only 1 or 2 minutes away! It was perfect for teenagers! It is also a very safe area.. except for pick pockets, you just have to be careful! You should really come here-!

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I've ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: ale5875
Reviews.Content: In 5 days we've found: a sticking plaster in the steak; hairs in nearly all the meals; dried snot on the pillow; dirty pants in the room (I'm not going to tell what that "dirt" was...); dirty bathtub. And when I asked if I could have my dirty pillow changed, they told me that they didn't want to and to go away. The only good thing is the position, as it's in the centre of Madrid. But all the rest is awful. The food was often uneatable. Thank god there are many bars and a Starbucks near there, so you don't die of starvation.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hostel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dsjdoc
Reviews.Content: Went with large group for weekend away to see sights of Madrid. We try to do things as cheaply as possible. Shared a room with 3 others, for £19 - inc breakfast. All wants were good beds, clean, Hot water and Breakfast- All achieved easily. The location is good, central, but hence noisy at night - but thats partly due to Spain coming alive at night. Amazing value

Reviews.Title: “The best, its location”
Reviews.Author: pepitopulpito
Reviews.Content: Very cheap for the location where it is, right in the city center in Madrid. Room was big enough. Just a regular hostel, clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price about right”
Reviews.Author: patrick1971
Reviews.Content: The Nuria is very centrally located which was a plus. It is on a main street so not recommended if you're a light sleeper. The reception staff speak very little English so you will need a Spanish phrasebook. The rooms are small and the decor is not the newest, but at this price that is what you expect. A good bonus of this hotel is that there is a shower in the room, not down the hall as with most hotels of this class. The shower is pretty small though - be warned! One annoying thing was that when I was paying, the reception desk put the card through in UK pound sterling (i.e. using dynamic currency conversion). I asked to pay in Euro instead and the woman allegedly couldn't work the machine to make this happen, which I didn't really believe; DCC is a well-known tourist rip off. So pay in cash if you can. Generally recommended for the single traveller as a step up from a youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: Meccii
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight very tired and were amazed and disappointed with the staff as anyone on the reception did not speak English! Not even a word! It turns out that our room window faced another building and we did not see anything apart from the surrounding walls. The air conditioning was working but with no possibility to set it up for lower or higher degree, therefore was nice and cool during the day, but too cold on the night! It was impossible to sleep without it as the room got hot quickly. Breakfast was the same every day, just roll, butter and jam with coffee or tea. The only pluses that are worth mentioning were the bathroom and location. I would not stayed there again and considered other possibilities if I knew it is so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: Montbau
Reviews.Content: Lot of comments on Nuria... Here's mine. I booked directly on their web-site for 31Euros/night. The hotel is very easy to reach by metro Tribunal, very central position. I have found the people very professionnal, sympathic, always ready to give indications. So the comments on rudeness did not apply, but, was it because I was speaking spanish all the time? Room is very basic but clean everyday and the shower is very small. Hairy guys and woman with long hair might have problems to rince :) I took once the breakfast (2.65Euros for bread rool and coffee): you will have more at supermarket. The street is noisy, this is a fact, even though there is in the room huge shutters, it is not enough to cover the noise's street. Publics services take the garbage around 1:00am so expect lot of noise and the Spaniards live in the streets, keep that in mind too. As others, the main problem is the regular group that comes in the hotel. Young Spaniards kids: they like to talk, they talk loud and for a long time. I was on 4th floor and there is an inner-stair between 3th and 4th floor so the voices were going up and nobody said something about that, it was almost normal. Poor people at 2nd floor! So, if you need a safe place, you can leave your room in peace and have fun in Madrid. But if you are staying for a long time and you need to rest, you shall avoid the Nuria.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: hawaii_traveler03
Reviews.Content: If this is a place that you need for just one night, it might be suitable, but I would not stay here for longer or ever again. The staff is not pleasant. They hardly smiled or greeted you. The next morning we went to get some breakfast and came back with our room cleaned and all our items gone. They thought we were checking out when we didn't tell them we were leaving. I had a table full of snacks and noticed that some of our items were placed outside the room with a few of my items missing. I asked them where my items were and they didn't know or couldn't tell me in English. A few minutes later after taking our things back into the room, my missing items appeared outside our room in a ziplock bag. I don't know why they did that. It was super loud at this location. Our room was right on the street and we could not sleep. The people who live in that location love to party. Broken glass could be heard, early in the morning, and people non-stop talked. The showers were incredibly small and leaked because the drains didn't work right. We had to soak up all the water that overflowed from the shower with the towels we were using to dry ourselves with. Overall, I would not stay here again or recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nuria 2002”
Reviews.Author: Clovergal
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I stayed there for one night. That was the first time I had ever been to Europe and the staff was very friendly and helpful to us. The area in which it's located is a little seedy, but it wasn't too bad. The rooms are small and the shower was odd, but it wasn't bad for the price (we paid $20/each).

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude Rude”
Reviews.Author: Ptbcn
Reviews.Content: I reserved the room via the hotel's own website. And then I need to cancel it. I called the hotel, and the staff told me to process hte cancellation online. But the hotel's website has no such section. so I called again, then she told me she just did it for me. I received not confirmation for this cancellation and I don't want to go to dispute process in case that it does not go thru and my credit card is charged. A few days after, I called again. The staff was rude to me. She asked for reservation number which I did not get (I had the email, the printout of the receipt in front of me), so she implied as if I could not be done!! The half screamed at me with a very condescending tone. BTW, my Spanish is not good and she could not speak English. While I tried to get her to explain to me more, she hung up the phone!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, yes, but I would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Zuzzy
Reviews.Content: This was by far the cheapest place I found for a single room with shared bathroom in such a central location. I should specify that it is shared toilet, because the room did actually have a bathtub and a sink. The room was pretty sad-looking but the biggest problem I encountered was the noise, due to the fact that the hotel is right on Fuencarral and the windows don't close properly... The rooms on the inside might be quieter. Also, there is only one toilet per floor and in my case it was quite a walk from the room... which can be rather inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it.”
Reviews.Author: skyjenn
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible place to stay. The room we got looked nothing like the picture on the website. It was like a dungeon, with lumpy beds and pillows wrapped in plastic. The tile in the bathroom was covered in mold, and the staff was unfriendly and mostly didn't speak english. Also they lock you in the hotel at night and you can't get out until the clerk comes from next door with the key.

Reviews.Title: “Staff rude and agressive”
Reviews.Author: Truform
Reviews.Content: Avoid at all costs. Staff members were very rude and even took to threats. Rooms had a bare minimum which was expected for the price. However, customer care is non existent and any requests were met with a hand in the face. Unreal! AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but. . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hostal is in a good location but might be best suited for student travelers. There were many students there during my stay and they didn't shy from making plenty of noise at night. I got the sense that it seems to cater to the student population. Staff does not speak English and did not exercise great patience with me or other guests. You get what you pay for. I would not stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Nuria Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 52 Fuencarral, 28004 Madrid, Spain
